description: This is a market on whether the time between the first and second finisher of the 2021 Tour de France will be less than one minute. The resolution source for this market will be the cumulative race times indicated in the general rankings section of the official Tour de France website (https://www.letour.fr/en/rankings; select the “General Ranking” and “Individual” tabs, and view the “Times” column). The market will resolve to “Yes” if the difference between the cumulative race time of the first place finisher in the general rankings of the 2021 Tour de France and cumulative race time of the second finisher in the general rankings of the 2021 Tour de France is less than one minute (60 seconds). If the difference in cumulative race times is equal to or greater than one minute (60 seconds), this market will resolve to “No”. This market will resolve after the final (21st) stage of the Tour de France is completed, currently scheduled for July 18, 2021 (https://www.letour.fr/en/overall-route), and there is a definitive first and second place finisher in the general rankings for the 2021 Tour de France. If there is no official first and second place finisher in the general rankings for the 2021 Tour de France or cumulative race times for the first and second place finishers are not available by July 31, 2021, this market will resolve 50-50. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

events.title: Will the winning margin of the 2021 Tour de France be less than 1 minute?

question: Will the winning margin of the 2021 Tour de France be less than 1 minute?
